intro: Cheiridopsis velutina, commonly known as the velvet ice plant, is a succulent species native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its unique adaptations to arid environments. The plant features fleshy, blue-green leaves covered in a fine, velvety coating that helps reduce water loss. It produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow and orange during the winter months. Cheiridopsis velutina is well-suited for rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appeal.
